title: LR circuit - resistance from potential graph

content.question: A circuit consists of a battery, an open switch, a <math alttext="1 millihenry" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>mH</mtext></math> inductor, and a resistor connected in series. The switch is closed at time <math alttext="t equals 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></math> and the electric potential difference across the inductor as a function of time is shown in the graph. What is the resistance of the circuit?

topic.text: 13.5: Circuits with Resistors and Inductors (LR Circuits)

skill.text: 2.B: Calculate or estimate an unknown quantity with units from known quantities, by selecting and following a logical computational pathway.
